greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(0) = 1 and for n > 0: a(n) = number of indices 0 <= i <= n with A033307(i)=A033307(n), where A033307 is the sequence of decimal digits of Champernowne's constant 0.123456789101112131415...
link: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
program: a065648_list = f (0 : a033307_list) $ take 10 $ repeat 1 where
f (d:ds) counts = y : f ds (xs ++ (y + 1) : ys) where
results.author: Klaus Strassburger (strass(AT)ddfi.uni-duesseldorf.de), Nov 09 2001
ext: Definition and offset adjusted to follow a later change of A033307. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Aug 13 2015
